Herbal Remedies: One creative solution to treat a common cold without medication is to rely on herbal remedies. Herbs such as ginger, peppermint, and echinacea have natural antiviral and anti-inflammatory properties that can help alleviate cold symptoms. For example, ginger has been shown to reduce inflammation and ease congestion, while peppermint can help clear nasal passages and ease coughing. Echinacea, on the other hand, has antiviral properties that can help reduce the severity of cold symptoms.

Honey and Lemon: Another creative solution is to use honey and lemon to treat a common cold. Honey has antibacterial and anti-inflammatory properties that can help soothe a sore throat and reduce coughing. Lemon, on the other hand, has natural decongestant properties that can help clear nasal passages and ease congestion. Mixing honey and lemon in hot water or tea can provide relief from cold symptoms.

Salt Water Gargle: A simple and effective way to treat a common cold without medication is to use a salt water gargle. Gargling with warm salt water can help reduce swelling in the throat and ease a sore throat. Salt water can also help reduce inflammation and kill bacteria in the throat, which can help alleviate cold symptoms.

Steam Inhalation: Another creative solution is to use steam inhalation to treat a common cold. Inhaling steam from a bowl of hot water or a steam humidifier can help loosen mucus and ease congestion in the nose and throat. Steam inhalation can also help reduce inflammation and kill bacteria in the respiratory system, which can help alleviate cold symptoms.
